page_content:
Web Reports

Version:MissionOS_2.0

The report builder can create individual reports and summary reports for each instrument type and subtype.

Use the Web Report button to view an HTML report of the selected individual instrument(s) reports. For summary reports the user is directed to the report builder in the Batched Report section.

 

 

You can set up report templates using the path Admin > Object Configuration > Object Definition > Tables. Here you can edit the table header, definition, set up, data fields, and layout. One of the templates needs to be set as ‘Default’ as web reports are generated in this ‘Default’ template. (Refer the figure below)

 

 

Header:

Refer to the highlighted area in the figure below to see how the header settings in the Table apply to the actual Report created.

 

 

Definition:

Refer to the highlighted area in the figure below to see how the definition settings in the Table apply to the actual Report created.

 

 

Web reports are drafted from the default graph template set for the selected instrument(s). Date selection for the graph template is also displayed here.

 

 

Setup:

The setup fields created for the instrument in the Table appears in the actual web report as seen highlighted in the figure below.

 

 

Data:

The data and calculation fields setup in the Table appears in the Web Report as in the figure below.

 

 

Web reports can be selected for multiple instruments belonging to the same subtype.

 

 

This action prompts a pop up with two menus for selecting either ‘All instruments in single graph’ or selecting ‘Individual Graph for each Instrument’.

 

 

Select All instruments in single graph to create a combined graph of all selected instruments.

 

 

Select the option - Individual Graph for each Instrument to create a web report with single graph for each individual instruments.

 

To watch the Web User Manual video on How to configure and generate Web Reports from the Instrument Data interface, simply click on the thumbnail or link below:

videos.title: How To: Configure and Generate Web Reports in MissionOS
